title: Candy Dulfer - Big Girl (1995)@flac
description:
In my opinion, this album is a real masterpiece, a true synergy of brilliant technical performance and flawless production. 
While Candy's sound is often described as "smooth jazz", for this one I'd rather say it's "acid jazz" because of strong hip-hop influence on a lot of tracks, like "Wake Me When It's Over", "2 Miles" and especially the title track. 
Also, there is some heavy-funk ("Tommy Gun", "Funkyness"), jazz ("Jazz It's Me") and a couple of ballads ("September", "Capone"). But even slow-tempo tracks never lapse into Sanborn-fuzak, nicely fitting space in between the energetic funky tracks, which prevail here. Only one track, the utterly commercial pop ballad "I'll Still Be Looking Up To You" breaks the album's flow, but since it's track 13, you'll probably be so excited by that time, that you won't pay attention. The arrangements are great, especially when it comes to combining live and computer-generated sounds. 
The unforgettable journey, and the best choice to start with, if you are unfamiliar with Candy's music. (From Amazon)
